page.title: 06FARMING IN SALPERTON
page.content: Salperton Park was once a manor with the home farm and a small amount of land attached.The present estate farms 640 hectares in a square block.The farm manager's office is in what was once the home farm yard.It is a traditional Cotswold mixed farming estate with a 160 Friesian Dairy Unit,500 breeding ewes,and 400 hectares used for cereal growing and break crops(usually rape).There is also an extensive shoot. The fields are enclosed with well maintained fencing,dry stone walls and hedges.There are coppices of both deciduous and coniferous trees, some recently planted,and many single trees in the fields,providing shelter for the animals.
